intro: Haloragis colensoi, commonly known as the Colenso's willow herb, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Haloragaceae and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as stream sides and forest floors. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, often covered with a fine layer of hairs. Haloragis colensoi is an important component of New Zealand's native flora and is often found in conservation areas.
